name: thingness
content:

the fact of existing as a physical object: The great thing about drawing is the thingness that emerges when you make a mark on some paper. I was thrilled at the thingness of the printed book, which provided a physical expression of all the work I had put into it.
More examplesFewer examplesMany philosophers see events and processes as more fundamental expressions of thingness than concepts such as substance and matter.By surrounding his paintings with thick wooden frames he draws attention to their thingness.Some artists think of light as a means of illuminating things, but she is concerned with the very thingness of light.
